name: cancel execution or copy data
description:
If the condition is fulfilled, this function cancels execution of all functions, that depend on this executor. In a loop, it is equivalent to cancelling current iteration, like the "continue" Java or C operator; in a usual chain it is an analog of the "return" operator from Java or C function.
If the condition is not fulfilled, this function just copies all inputs (when exist) to the corresponding outputs.

in_ports.caption: if (xxx)
in_ports.name: if
in_ports.hint: Should contain scalar value, indication true/false condition (see "What string is true").

out_ports.caption: checked "xxx" condition
out_ports.name: checked_condition
out_ports.hint:
Boolean condition, actually checked by "if" operator: "true" means a request to cancel execution.
Note that it always contains a normal value; unlike this, all other output data
will contain special reserved value when the condition is "true" â€”
this value leads to cancelling execution of all depending functions.

out_ports.name: s
out_ports.hint:
Copy of the corresponding input or, if the condition is fulfilled,
a special reserved value, leading to skipping execution of all depending functions.

controls.caption: What string is true
controls.name: conditionStyle
controls.description:
What input condition "xxx" is considered to be true and what is false.

C-like: true is non-zero number or non-empty string, containing not a number, false is 0, 0.0, empty, non-initialized string.

Java-like: true is "true" string (ignoring case), false is any other string, including non-initialized.

Note that "true" string, according these rules, is considered to be true in all modes.

controls.caption: Invert condition
controls.name: invert
controls.description: If set, the input condition above is inverted: execution is cancelled when "xxx" is false and continued (with a copy of input data) when "xxx" is true.
